_usage: This data is restricted and may only be used with explicit permission from MetService NZ. Contact dataenquiries@metservice.com

ROAD_SNOWFALL_WARNINGS.content:
Road Snowfall Warning

Area: Arthur's Pass (SH73)

Period: 15hrs from 3am - 6pm Sun, 4 Sep

Forecast: Snow showers may affect higher parts of the road during Sunday morning and afternoon, where 1 cm of snow may accumulate at times.

Area: Crown Range Road

Period: 6hrs from noon Sat, 3 Sep - 6pm Sat, 3 Sep

Forecast: Snow showers are possible this afternoon, where 1 to 2 cm of snow may accumulate on the road above 900 metres.

Area: Milford Road (SH94)

Period: 21hrs from 3pm Sat, 3 Sep - noon Sun, 4 Sep

Forecast: Snow showers are possible from this afternoon through to Sunday morning. Where 8 to 12 cm of snow may accumulate on the road near the tunnel, with lesser amounts down to 600 metres.

Area: Dunedin to Waitati Highway (SH1)

Period: 4hrs from 8pm Sun, 4 Sep - midnight Sun, 4 Sep

Forecast: Snow showers may affect the summit of the road Sunday evening, where 1 cm or less of snow may accumulate. Note, further snow is likely during Monday.

Issued: 10:12am Sat, 3 Sep
Next update: 9pm Sat, 3 Sep

For more about Road Snowfall Warnings click here

SWELL_WARNINGS.content:
No Heavy Swell Warning in force for the Wellington, Wairarapa, Kapiti and Porirua coasts.

Swell warnings are issued directly to regional authorities for other selected coasts but are not currently published here.

SWWARNINGS+WATCHES.content:
Westerly gales for parts of southern and central New Zealand. Heavy rain for Northland.

Strong to gale westerlies bring showery conditions to southern and central New Zealand this weekend. A Strong Wind Watch is in place for Wellington this morning. On Sunday, west to southwest winds strengthen about the South Island. A Strong Wind Warning is in force for coastal Southland, Stewart Island and Clutha. A Strong Wind Watch also covers the Canterbury High Country, and remaining parts of Otago and Southland not covered by the Strong Wind Warning.

On Monday, a low pressure system is forecast to move onto the upper North Island, bringing a period of heavy rain and strong to gale easterlies. A Heavy Rain Watch is now in place for Northland.

People are advised to keep up to date with the latest forecasts in case any changes are made or more areas are added.

Strong Wind Warning - Orange

Impact: Strong wind gusts could damage trees, powerlines and unsecured structures. Driving may be hazardous, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles.

Area: Coastal Clutha and Southland, also Stewart Island

Period: 13hrs from 4am - 5pm Sun, 4 Sep

Forecast: Southwest winds, severe gale gusting 120 km/h in exposed places.

Heavy Rain Watch

Area: The north and east of Northland

Period: 12hrs from 9am - 9pm Mon, 5 Sep

Forecast: A period of heavy rain. Rainfall accumulations may approach warning amounts.

Strong Wind Watch

Area: Wellington

Period: 2hrs from 9am - 11am Sat, 3 Sep

Forecast: Northwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places.

Area: Canterbury High Country, Queenstown Lakes, Central Otago, Dunedin, and inland parts of Clutha and Southland

Period: 11hrs from 6am - 5pm Sun, 4 Sep

Forecast: Westerly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places.

Warnings no longer in force

Heavy Rain Warning - Orange lifted for : Westland from Otira southwards: Heavy rain has eased and the warning is now lifted.

Heavy Rain Warning - Orange lifted for : The headwaters of the Canterbury lakes and rivers south of Arthur's Pass: Heavy rain has eased and the warning is now lifted.

Heavy Rain Watch lifted for : Buller: Heavy rain has eased.

Heavy Rain Watch lifted for : The ranges of Westland north of Otira: Heavy rain has eased.

Issued: 9:05am Sat, 3 Sep
Next update: 9pm Sat, 3 Sep
